result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby Hakeem Welch

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:40am
INCLUDES 15CM1334 & 15CM1706
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
State moves to: 
15CM1334
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct-Domestic Abuse >> D&RI
15CM1706
Ct. 1 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CM1334
Ct. 1 Battery-Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 12 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement, which includes completing LEAP parenting program. Complete SAFE program with any counseling, treatment, or assessments deemed necessary by agent. 
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND Ct. 1 to County DC and remit court costs.

DEOJ RH 11/09/2016 at 1:10pm in DA office 

Atty Jackan asks to change no contact on bond with victim
COURT orders new bond to lift no contact order with victim
Bond continues.

Adj: 9:53am

Clerk Becky
INCLUDES 15CM1334 & 15CM1076
Case Called:
 9:32 am
State appears by ADA M. Puerner; Deft appears in person with Atty Jackan;

REQUEST TO LIFT NO CONTACT ORDER IN 15CM1334
State objects and makes argument;
Victim makes statement;
Atty Jackan makes statement;
COURT DENIES REQUEST


INITIAL APPEARANCE FOR 15CM1706
W/R
PLEA: NOT GUILTY

BOND>>
$500.00 signature bond
CONDITIONS:  
Non-waivable no contact with J.G.: W/ THE EXCEPTION: The deft may text J.G. regarding pregancy; not to text about the case


Adj: 9:42 am

No contact with victim(s): J.G.-NON WAIVABLE w/ the exception of texting regarding pregancy and not about the case. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
